body_html:
Following @Engineero's recommendation, I can use tf.zeros([batch_size, lstm_size, 2]) and I then get an error on the last line (lstm()) with:

TypeError: 'Tensor' object is not iterable.

Which is opaque to me, since it does not look like we are iterating on a Tensor.
body_text:
Following @Engineero's recommendation, I can use tf.zeros([batch_size, lstm_size, 2]) and I then get an error on the last line (lstm()) with:
TypeError: 'Tensor' object is not iterable.

Which is opaque to me, since it does not look like we are iterating on a Tensor.
body:
Following @Engineero's recommendation, I can use `tf.zeros([batch_size, lstm_size, 2])` and I then get an error on the last line (`lstm()`) with:
```
TypeError: 'Tensor' object is not iterable.
```
Which is opaque to me, since it does not look like we are iterating on a Tensor.
